meanings.definition: A linear trough in the earth's crust in which sediment accumulates.
meanings.sent1: The geosynclines formed a deep trench where sediment gathered.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study the geosynclines to understand how sediment builds up in troughs.
meanings.sent3: The geosynclines were like nature's own giant cereal bowl, filling up with sediment over time.
meanings.sent4: The geosynclines resembled long, earthy conveyor belts carrying sediment along their path.
meanings.sent5: In the geosynclines, layers of sediment piled up like a historical record etched in stone.

meanings.definition: A geologic structure in which rock strata have been deposited in a subsiding basin.
meanings.sent1: The geosynclines showed how rock layers settled in a sinking basin.
meanings.sent2: Rock formations in the geosynclines revealed the history of the subsiding basin.
meanings.sent3: It was as if the geosynclines were a massive rock library slowly sinking into the ground.
meanings.sent4: The geosynclines acted like a natural archive storing rock strata in a descending basin.
meanings.sent5: The geosynclines displayed a geological timeline etched in the layers of rock.
